tuv.seg: Withdrawing from the international protection process
Ag aistarraingt ón bpróiseas tearmainn
The International Protection Act 2015 provides for the withdrawal of applications for international protection (refugee status and subsidiary protection)
Foráiltear in Acht na nDídeanaithe, 1996, arna leasú, d’iarratais ar stádas dídeanaí a aistarraingt
You may withdraw your application at the first stage or at the appeal stage
Féadfaidh tú d’iarratas a aistarraingt ag an gcéad chéim nó ag céim an achomhairc
In certain circumstances your application may be deemed to be withdrawn – see below
Faoi roinnt cúinsí, féadtar a mheas gurb ionann d’iarratas agus aistarraingthe – féach thíos
Withdrawal at first stage
Aistarraingt ag an gcéad chéim

If your application for international protection is still under consideration by the International Protection Office, you may withdraw your application by notifying the Minister for Justice and Equality in writing
Má tá d'iarratas ar dhearbhú fós faoi bhreithniú ag Coimisinéir Iarratais do Dhídeanaithe, féadann tú d’iarratas a aistarraingt trína fhógairt do Choimisinéir Iarratais do Dhídeanaithe i scríbhinn
When the Minister is notified of your withdrawal, they will refuse to give you either a declaration of refugee status or a declaration of subsidiary protection
Ba cheart duit na fáthanna a leagan amach go soiléir go bhfuil tú ag aistarraingt d’achomhairc agus a chur in iúl go ndearna tú iarratas ar chead chun fanacht sa stát
If you have a solicitor, they will be notified
Fógrófar don Aire Dlí agus Cirt faoi d’aistarraingt
The Minister may arrange for your removal from the State unless you have been granted permission to remain in the State
Diúltóidh sé nó sí dearbhú a thabhairt duit agus féadann sé nó sí do bhaint den stát a eagrú mura ndearna tú iarratas air nó gur bronnadh cead chun fanacht duit sa Stát
Withdrawal at appeal stage
Aistarraingt ag céim an achomhairc
If you wish to withdraw at the appeal stage, you should send your notice of withdrawal to the International Protection Appeals Tribunal

Más mian leat aistarraingt a dhéanamh ag céim an achomhairc, ba cheart an fógra maidir le d’aistarraingt a dhéanamh i scríbhinn ar fhoirm Fógra Aistarraingthe atá ar fáil ón mBinse Achomhairc do Dhídeanaithe
If your appeal is withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn, the Minister for Justice and Equality will refuse to give you a refugee or subsidiary protection declaration
Ba cheart é a sheoladh chuig cathaoirleach an Bhinse Achomhairc do Dhídeanaithe
The Minister may then arrange for your removal from the State unless you have been granted permission to remain in the State or you have agreed to return voluntarily to your country of origin
Má dhéanann tú amhlaidh, seasfar le bunchinneadh an Choimisinéara um Iarratais ó Dhídeanaithe, nár cheart dearbhú a thabhairt duit gur dídeanaí thú

There are a number of circumstances in which failure on your part to comply with your statutory obligations may result in your application for international protection (or your appeal against refusal) being deemed withdrawn

Nuair a bhíonn foirm Fógra Aistarraingthe á comhlánú agat, ba cheart duit na cúiseanna a leagan amach go soiléir a bhfuil d’achomharc á aistarraingt agat agus a thabhair le fios má rinne tú iarratas ar chead chun fanacht sa Stát
In which case, the Minister shall refuse to give you a refugee status or subsidiary protection declaration
Má tá aturnae agat, ba cheart dó/di d’fhoirm Fógra Aistarraingthe a chomhshíniú
These are as follows:
Iarratais a meastar a bheith aistarraingthe
• Failure to inform the Minister for Justice and Equality of your address or change of address

Tá roinnt cúinsí ann ina bhféadfaí d’iarratas ar stádas teifigh a mheas mar aistarraingthe de bharr mainneachtana ar do leithse chun cloí le d’oibleagáidí reachtúla; agus ina ndiúltóidh an tAire dearbhú a thabhairt duit
• Failure to report when required to do so
Is iad seo na cúinsí:
• Failure to reside or remain at a particular district of place in the State when required to do so
• Mainneachtain seoladh a thabhairt don Choimisinéir laistigh de 5 lá oibre ó dhéanamh d’iarratais
• Leaving or attempting to leave the State without the consent of the Minister for Justice and Equality
• Mainneachtain an Coimisinéir a chur ar an eolas i dtaobh athrú seolta
• Failure to co-operate with the International Protection Office or to furnish information relevant to your application
• Mainneachtain teacht i láthair nuair is gá amhlaidh
• Failure to attend for interview with the International Protection Office
• Mainneachtain cónaí nó chun fanacht ag dúiche nó áit faoi leith sa Stát nuair is gá amhlaidh
• Failure to co-operate with the International Protection Appeals Tribunal or to furnish information relevant to your appeal
• Fágáil nó iarracht an Stát a fhágáil gan comhthoil an Aire
• Failure to attend for an oral hearing with the Tribunal, without reasonable cause
• Mainneachtain comhoibriú leis an gCoimisinéir Iarratais do Dhídeanaithe, nó chun faisnéis ar ábhartha do d’iarratas í a thabhairt
Where an application is withdrawn or is deemed withdrawn, there is no appeal
• Mainneachtain freastal ar agallamh leis an gCoimisinéir
If your application for international protection has been withdrawn or is deemed withdrawn, but you wish to apply again, you may be able to make a subsequent application
• Mainneachtain comhoibriú leis an mBinse Achomhairc do Dhídeanaithe, nó chun faisnéis ar ábhartha do d’achomharc í a thabhairt
You must first apply for the Minister’s consent to the making of a subsequent application
• Mainneachtain freastal ar éisteacht bhéil leis an mBinse
If the Minister consents to the making of a subsequent application, you should make the application within 10 working days
Ní bhíonn aon achomharc ann sa chás ina meastar iarratas a bheith aistarraingthe
